intro: Polygonatum multiflorum subsp. broteri, commonly known as the African yellow flag, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
